name: Introduction to Journalism
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of journalism and its impact on society. Topics covered include news writing, ethics, media law, and media criticism.

name: Introduction to Environmental Journalism
description: This course is an introduction to the emerging discipline of environmental journalism. It focuses on how to cover the environment and its related issues in a responsible and accurate manner.

name: Environmental Reporting
description: This course explores the complexities of environmental journalism through hands-on reporting and research. Students will learn how to research, write, and edit stories about environmental issues for print and broadcast media.

name: Environmental Anthropology
description: This course introduces students to the history and culture of environmental studies, from the study of environmental conservation to the impact of climate change.

name: Environmental Law and Policy
description: This course provides an overview of environmental law and policy, from local to global legislation.

name: Advanced Environmental Reporting
description: This advanced course builds upon the concepts taught in the introductory environmental journalism course. It focuses on in-depth reporting of complex environmental issues. Topics covered include investigative reporting, multimedia journalism, and data journalism.
